alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 10 at 12:49PM PST until January 11 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * CHANGES...Updated additional snowfall amounts based on snow shower bands. * WHAT...Snow showers with bands of heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches, with 7 to 14 inches with bands of heavier snow. Wind gusts up to 50 mph with ridgetop gusts in excess of 100 mph at times. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible, with potential for avalanches producing extended road closures. The series of winter storms since late December has made snow removal more challenging, with limited areas for holding the plowed snow. A few lightning strikes are possible near the Sierra crest. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Bands of snow showers continue through this evening, with whiteout conditions possible within heavier snow bands. Watch for rapid changes in visibility and road conditions, especially after sunset.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
